ratings.note: Publicly traded with strong institutional ownership. BB-range implied from bond spreads.

overview.business_description: Global aluminum products manufacturer supplying aerospace, automotive, and packaging sectors with rolled, extruded, and structural aluminum solutions. Key supplier to Airbus and major automakers. Operations in France, Germany, US.
business_positives: Publicly traded with $3.03bn market cap equity cushion
Strategic French state backing - Bpifrance owns ~9%
overview.fatal_flaw: CYCLICAL DOWNTURN: 2Q25 EBITDA -35% YoY. EBITDA declined -16.5% in FY24. Two bonds BELOW PAR (96.37, 99.00). Tariff exposure risk. Leverage increased to 3.3x in 1Q25. Revenue declining for 2 consecutive years. Jan 2026 factoring facility maturity approaching.
overview.ownership: Public (NYSE: CSTM). Key shareholders: Bpifrance (French state, ~9%), Fidelity ($166m), BlackRock ($119m), Millennium ($103m).
overview.recent_news: 2Q25 EBITDA declines 35% YoY to $146m (Jul 2025). 1Q25 leverage reaches 3.3x (Apr 2025). European tariff impacts assessed (Apr 2025). Credit metrics deteriorate as cyclical downturn bites (Feb 2025).

key_ratios.note: Leverage elevated vs historical (was 2.4x in 2023). Cyclical pressure on EBITDA.

trend_analysis.trend_summary: EBITDA declined -16.5% in FY24 and -35% YoY in 2Q25. Revenue down for 2 consecutive years. Leverage increased from 2.4x trough to 3.0x. Cyclical downturn impacting credit metrics.

maturity_schedule.note: Jan 2026 factoring facility maturity. 2028-2032 bonds well-laddered.

aerospace.trend: Recovery from COVID, new aircraft builds

automotive.trend: Lightweighting demand but EV transition uncertainty

credit_opinion.summary: Constellium is experiencing a cyclical downturn with 2Q25 EBITDA -35% YoY and FY24 EBITDA -16.5%. Two bonds trading below par (96.37, 99.00) reflecting market concern. However, the company has a $3bn market cap equity cushion and strategic French state backing through Bpifrance (~9%). Net leverage at 2.8x is manageable. 2032 bonds above par (103-105) suggest long-term confidence. Key risks are tariff exposure, cyclical end-markets, and near-term EBITDA pressure. Aerospace recovery and automotive lightweighting provide structural support.

distress_indicators.trading_signals: Mixed - 2029 bonds BELOW PAR (96.37, 99.00) but 2032 bonds above par (103-105). EBITDA declining sharply. Cyclical downturn. $3bn equity cushion provides support.
